intro: Castilleja fissifolia subvar. coronopifolia, commonly known as the Sierra red globemallow, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Its leaves are opposite and linear, while its stems are often branched and hairy. Castilleja fissifolia subvar. coronopifolia relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it a partial parasite.
